entry.title: Some Good Stuff
entry.content:
Rencently, I’m studying Java in depth (after the realization that I was playing rather than using it).

Recommended Books:

Effective Java 2nd Edition

Some good websites in case someone in the near future ask you similar questions:

  • Java-related:

    • Why you should rewrite hashcode

    • How does GC work in JVM

    • What is Zero Copy and how to achieve it

  • Math-related:

    • Probability of Hash collision (I like the math here, bring back old times lol)

entry.title: Hover Board for Real
entry.content:
Couple of monthes ago, I saw video(starring Tony Hawk) entitled “Hover board”.

But, it was a hoax.

Now, this time the real “Conan” board staring the very same person.

Check this out

entry.title: This Is Cool
entry.content:
You think Google Glass is cool? (it is without doubt)

Check out this video

I heard that Steve Jobs spends at least half an hour on meditation every day.

Calm down your mind and stay focus.

I want to see how my brain works, might will buy one of this. Definitely cheaper then Google Glass.

PS: thanks Mashable for sharing this news.

entry.title: Goodjob Facebook
entry.content:
Wow, the ice buckget challenge is on heat !

People @ Facebook are crazy. Nice place to work & nice people to meet

strikeoutALS

Link to the people in facebook. Might need login credential, but yeah most browsers store that in cache (not session).

entry.title: Cool Hyperlapse by MSFT Research
entry.content:
Its been a while not posting anything. Well, now I’m back =D

This is pretty cool stuff.

Despite its fails(unwise decisions) in many other fields recent years(Win Phone, Xbox, some Nokia), Microsoft Research is still delivering astonishing good stuff. Check out this video. Its a awesome way to use augumented reality =D

Good job MSFT Research
